title: 114_s2043
content: The "Know Before You Owe Federal Student Loan Act of 2015" requires periodic disclosures during periods when loan payments are not required. Section 433 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require eligible lenders to provide borrowers with periodic statements during periods when loan payments are not required. The statements must include details such as the original principal amount of each loan, the aggregate original principal amount, and the borrower's current balance. The amended Section 433 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 mandates lenders to provide borrowers with periodic statements. These statements must include loan details like interest rates, total interest paid, total amount paid (including fees), lender's contact information, and an explanation of the option to pay accrued interest while in school or during deferment. The amended Section 433 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 requires lenders to provide borrowers with periodic statements. These statements include details such as interest rates, total interest paid, total amount paid, lender's contact information, and options to pay accrued interest. If the borrower does not pay interest while in school or during deferment, the accumulated interest will be capitalized when the loan goes into repayment, resulting in more interest paid over the loan's life. The statement also includes the amount of interest accumulated since the last statement, aggregate interest accrued to date, and a suggested payment amount equal to the interest charged since the last installment period. SEC. 3. PRE-LOAN COUNSELING AND CERTIFICATION OF LOAN AMOUNT. Section 485(l) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to change "Entrance Counseling" to "Pre-Loan Counseling" and modify requirements for counseling and disbursement of new loans. The amendment to Section 485(l) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 includes changing "Entrance Counseling" to "Pre-Loan Counseling" and updating requirements for estimating a borrower's loan debt-to-income ratio upon graduation. The amendment to Section 485(l) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 includes adding new requirements for pre-loan counseling, such as advising borrowers to borrow the minimum amount necessary, warning about high debt-to-income ratios, providing options to reduce borrowing, and emphasizing the importance of graduating on time. The Higher Education Act of 1965 amendment includes new requirements for pre-loan counseling, emphasizing the importance of graduating on time and providing information on the impact of additional study years on total indebtedness. Additionally, eligible institutions must ensure students manually enter the exact dollar amount of Federal direct loan funding they desire to borrow before certification. The Higher Education Act of 1965 amendment introduces new requirements for pre-loan counseling, replacing entrance and exit counseling with pre-loan and exit counseling. Additionally, regulatory relief and improvement involve changing entrance and exit interviews to pre-loan and exit interviews.
